hints.content:
To find how long the $\blueE{\text{Canoe}}$ and $\maroonD{\text{Double canoe}}$ are together, we need to find the total.  So, we add.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/af5bf84be966e3159327f4874c59c7a7da248775)

$\blueE{18}\text{ feet}  + \maroonD{55}\text{ feet} =\purpleD{\square}\text{ feet}$

Let's add to find the total.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/905c8978f4bb4f7d315c90f5a979137ae09ef018)


$\blueE{18}\text{ feet}  + \maroonD{55}\text{ feet} =\purpleD{73}\text{ feet}$
The canoe and double canoe measure $\purpleD{73}\text{ ft}$ combined.

question.content:
Moana measures the lengths of the different boats on her island.

Boat | Length
- | - | -
Canoe | $18 \text { ft}$ 
Sailboat | $46 \text { ft}$ 
Double canoe |  $55 \text { ft}$ 

**What is the length of the canoe and double canoe combined?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ft}$
